channel.title: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)
channel.description: I recently "purchased" vegas movie studio 6.0c and when i click on the .exe file, it comes up saying "mscoree.dll could not be found" i'm got the mscoree.dll, but i don't know which file to put it in. anybody know where it goes??

item.title: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)
item.dc:creator: @apzrman apzrman
item.description:
@apzrman wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:5, topic:114967”][quote author=apzrman link=topic=164165.msg1535383#msg1535383 date=1182599916]

And BTW 6.0c is pretty old… Update it to 7.0d

thx guys, this helps me soo much.

when i said “purchased” i meant i had downloaded it, so i don’t think it’d let me upgrade from the product site with a pirated lisence.
[/quote]

I realized that, by update I meant “Download and crack the newest version”[/quote]
my sources are limited (i use ares), but i’m happy with it. i only really need it when my friends want me to edit the films they make (friends want to start up a group like jackass).

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)

item.title: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You put mscoree.dll inside the C:\WINDOWS\system32\ folder.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)

item.title: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)

And BTW 6.0c is pretty old… Update it to 7.0d
[/quote]
thx guys, this helps me soo much.

when i said “purchased” i meant i had downloaded it, so i don’t think it’d let me upgrade from the product site with a pirated lisence.[/quote]

I realized that, by update I meant “Download and crack the newest version”

item.title: Need help with vegas movie studio (mscoree.dll problem)
item.dc:creator: @Flaming_Idiot Flaming Idiot
item.description:
@Flaming_Idiot wrote:

You need to download the .NET framework, because chances are, it will need more than mscoree.dll.
